channel.title: Danielle M. Stevens
channel.description: Recent content on Danielle M. Stevens

item.title: Comparative Genomics of Clavibacter Bacteria
item.description: Clavibacter bacteria are host specific pathogens with many predicted virulence effectors. Clavibacter species cause disease on a narrow host range of plants, but their ability to colonize endophytically is broad.

item.title: Plant Immune Perception of Gram-positive Bacteria
item.description: Plant innate immune systems perceive and elicit responses to limit pathogens. Surface-localized pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) can perceive molecular features such as MAMPs, damage-associated molecular patterns, and effectors from diverse pathogens.

item.title: Plant Targets of Tomato Pathogen C. michiganensis Protease Effectors
Describing the Variability of PAMP-triggered immune response in Citrus
